message: Seems to be your worst enemy. It makes you believe that everything is doable. Is it really? At what cost? How long will it take? Is it worth it?
You are your own greatest enemy. Those are the questions you ask yourself? Decide and then act.
Build a network of smart friends who can supplement you with "news from the field," try to keep your goals incremental, and allow yourself to revise and pivot.
You have to be very driven.   And it applies to anything you do, sports, business, school.

Try focusing on small victories that lead to a big prize, but do it in a scrum-like "agile" way by making sure whenever you achieve a victory the outcome is adding value enough that you can walk away and something is still gained from it
It seems that your mind can sometimes over power you.  Your mind will sometimes convince yourself that something is right.

There is a difference between something being "right" and something being "doable." With enough time/effort/money just about everything is doable, and that doesn't necessarily make it right. Getting your ideas out of your mind (on paper, on the screen, in front of people, etc) is the best way to test them.
Keep going. Take breaks and holidays. Keep going. Keep going and KEEP GOING!
Take this advice from Galaxy Quest - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e-VMTIPwk74

You'll never know what is right - that's the hardest part - keep trying - keep testing reality - adjust when required - but keep trying. The willingness to sustain through the immense highs and lows is vital, if you don't believe me check out - http://www.foundersatwork.com/
Pretty vague question. I guess for me its the old 'you miss 100% of the shots you dont take' along with 'failures only a problem if you dont learn anything from it'

Take actions that put you in a position where it's very difficult to go in any direction other than straight toward your goal. Want to learn a new language? Live where it's spoken. Want to do less client work? Fire some clients. It's pretty extreme, but you make these decisions when you know they're right and you never look back.
